info.title: Okta API
info.description: Allows customers to easily access the Okta API

get.description: Enumerates apps added to your organization with pagination. A subset of apps can be returned that match a supported filter expression or query.

parameters.description: Specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of apps
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: Specifies the number of results for a page
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Filters apps by status, user.id, group.id or credentials.signing.kid expression
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: Traverses users link relationship and optionally embeds Application User resource
parameters.name: expand

post.description: Adds a new application to your Okta organization.

parameters.description: Executes activation lifecycle operation when creating the app
parameters.name: activate

delete.description: Removes an inactive application.

get.description: Fetches an application from your Okta organization by `id`.

put.description: Updates an application in your organization.

get.description: Enumerates Certificate Signing Requests for an application
get.summary: List Certificate Signing Requests for Application

post.description: Generates a new key pair and returns the Certificate Signing Request for it.
post.summary: Generate Certificate Signing Request for Application

get.description: Enumerates key credentials for an application

post.description: Generates a new X.509 certificate for an application key credential

get.description: Gets a specific application key credential by kid

post.description: Clones a X.509 certificate for an application key credential from a source application to target application.

parameters.description: Unique key of the target Application
parameters.name: targetAid

get.description: Lists all scope consent grants for the application

post.description: Grants consent for the application to request an OAuth 2.0 Okta scope

delete.description: Revokes permission for the application to request the given scope

get.description: Fetches a single scope consent grant for the application
Enumerates group assignments for an application.

parameters.description: Specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of assignments
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: Specifies the number of results for a page
parameters.name: limit

delete.description: Removes a group assignment from an application.

get.description: Fetches an application group assignment

put.description: Assigns a group to an application

post.description: Activates an inactive application.
Deactivates an active application.

delete.description: Revokes all tokens for the specified application

get.description: Lists all tokens for the application

delete.description: Revokes the specified token for the specified application

get.description: Gets a token for the specified application
Enumerates all assigned [application users](#application-user-model) for an application.

parameters.description: specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of assignments
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: specifies the number of results for a page
parameters.name: limit

post.description: Assigns an user to an application with [credentials](#application-user-credentials-object) and an app-specific [profile](#application-user-profile-object). Profile mappings defined for the application are first applied before applying any profile properties specified in the request.
post.summary: Assign User to Application for SSO & Provisioning

delete.description: Removes an assignment for a user from an application.

get.description: Fetches a specific user assignment for application by `id`.

post.description: Updates a user's profile for an application
post.summary: Update Application Profile for Assigned User

get.description: Enumerates groups in your organization with pagination. A subset of groups can be returned that match a supported filter expression or query.

parameters.description: Searches the name property of groups for matching value
parameters.name: q

parameters.description: Filter expression for groups
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of groups
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: Specifies the number of group results in a page
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: If specified, it causes additional metadata to be included in the response.
parameters.name: expand

post.description: Adds a new group with `OKTA_GROUP` type to your organization.

get.description: Lists all group rules for your organization.

parameters.description: Specifies the number of rule results in a page
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of rules
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: Specifies the keyword to search fules for
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: If specified as `groupIdToGroupNameMap`, then show group names
parameters.name: expand

post.description: Creates a group rule to dynamically add users to the specified group if they match the condition

delete.description: Removes a specific group rule by id from your organization

parameters.description: Indicates whether to keep or remove users from groups assigned by this rule.
parameters.name: removeUsers

get.description: Fetches a specific group rule by id from your organization

put.description: Updates a group rule. Only `INACTIVE` rules can be updated.

post.description: Activates a specific group rule by id from your organization
Deactivates a specific group rule by id from your organization

delete.description: Removes a group with `OKTA_GROUP` type from your organization.

get.description: Lists all group rules for your organization.

put.description: Updates the profile for a group with `OKTA_GROUP` type from your organization.

get.description: Enumerates all applications that are assigned to a group.

parameters.description: Specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of apps
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: Specifies the number of app results for a page
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Success

post.description: Assigns a Role to a Group

delete.description: Unassigns a Role from a Group

get.description: Success

Lists all App targets for an `APP_ADMIN` Role assigned to a Group. This methods return list may include full Applications or Instances. The response for an instance will have an `ID` value, while Application will not have an ID.

delete.description: Success
Remove App Instance Target to App Administrator Role given to a Group

get.description: Success

parameters.description: Specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of users
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: Specifies the number of user results in a page
parameters.name: limit

delete.description: Removes a user from a group with 'OKTA_GROUP' type.

put.description: Adds a user to a group with 'OKTA_GROUP' type.

get.description: Enumerates IdPs in your organization with pagination. A subset of IdPs can be returned that match a supported filter expression or query.

parameters.description: Searches the name property of IdPs for matching value
parameters.name: q

parameters.description: Specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of IdPs
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: Specifies the number of IdP results in a page
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Filters IdPs by type
parameters.name: type

post.description: Adds a new IdP to your organization.

get.description: Enumerates IdP key credentials.

parameters.description: Specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of keys
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: Specifies the number of key results in a page
parameters.name: limit

post.description: Adds a new X.509 certificate credential to the IdP key store.

delete.description: Deletes a specific IdP Key Credential by `kid` if it is not currently being used by an Active or Inactive IdP.

get.description: Gets a specific IdP Key Credential by `kid`

delete.description: Removes an IdP from your organization.

get.description: Fetches an IdP by `id`.

put.description: Updates the configuration for an IdP.

get.description: Enumerates Certificate Signing Requests for an IdP
get.summary: List Certificate Signing Requests for IdP

post.description: Generates a new key pair and returns a Certificate Signing Request for it.
post.summary: Generate Certificate Signing Request for IdP

delete.description: Revoke a Certificate Signing Request and delete the key pair from the IdP

get.description: Gets a specific Certificate Signing Request model by id

post.description: Update the Certificate Signing Request with a signed X.509 certificate and add it into the signing key credentials for the IdP.

get.description: Enumerates signing key credentials for an IdP
get.summary: List Signing Key Credentials for IdP

post.description: Generates a new X.509 certificate for an IdP signing key credential to be used for signing assertions sent to the IdP

parameters.description: expiry of the IdP Key Credential
parameters.name: validityYears

post.summary: Generate New IdP Signing Key Credential

get.description: Gets a specific IdP Key Credential by `kid`
get.summary: Get Signing Key Credential for IdP

post.description: Clones a X.509 certificate for an IdP signing key credential from a source IdP to target IdP
post.summary: Clone Signing Key Credential for IdP

post.description: Activates an inactive IdP.
Deactivates an active IdP.

get.description: Find all the users linked to an identity provider

delete.description: Removes the link between the Okta user and the IdP user.

get.description: Fetches a linked IdP user by ID

post.description: Links an Okta user to an existing Social Identity Provider. This does not support the SAML2 Identity Provider Type
post.summary: Link a user to a Social IdP without a transaction

get.description: Fetches the tokens minted by the Social Authentication Provider when the user authenticates with Okta via Social Auth.
Success

post.description: Success

delete.description: Deletes the Inline Hook matching the provided id. Once deleted, the Inline Hook is unrecoverable. As a safety precaution, only Inline Hooks with a status of INACTIVE are eligible for deletion.

get.description: Gets an inline hook by ID

put.description: Updates an inline hook by ID

post.description: Executes the Inline Hook matching the provided inlineHookId using the request body as the input. This will send the provided data through the Channel and return a response if it matches the correct data contract. This execution endpoint should only be used for testing purposes.
Activates the Inline Hook matching the provided id
Deactivates the Inline Hook matching the provided id

get.description: The Okta System Log API provides read access to your organizations system log. This API provides more functionality than the Events API
get.summary: Fetch a list of events from your Okta organization system log.

get.description: Enumerates Profile Mappings in your organization with pagination.
Fetches a single Profile Mapping referenced by its ID.

post.description: Updates an existing Profile Mapping by adding, updating, or removing one or many Property Mappings.

get.description: Fetches the Schema for an App User
get.summary: Fetches the Schema for an App User

post.description: Partial updates on the User Profile properties of the Application User Schema.
post.summary: Partial updates on the User Profile properties of the Application User Schema.

get.description: Success

post.description: Success

delete.description: Success

get.description: Success
Fetches the schema for a Schema Id.
get.summary: Fetches the schema for a Schema Id.

post.description: Partial updates on the User Profile properties of the user schema.

get.description: Fetches all User Types in your org

post.description: Creates a new User Type. A default User Type is automatically created along with your org, and you may add another 9 User Types for a maximum of 10.

delete.description: Deletes a User Type permanently. This operation is not permitted for the default type, nor for any User Type that has existing users

get.description: Fetches a User Type by ID. The special identifier `default` may be used to fetch the default User Type.

post.description: Updates an existing User Type

get.description: Gets all policies with the specified type.

post.description: Creates a policy.

delete.description: Removes a policy.

get.description: Gets a policy.

post.description: Activates a policy.
Deactivates a policy.

get.description: Enumerates all policy rules.

post.description: Creates a policy rule.

delete.description: Removes a policy rule.

get.description: Gets a policy rule.

post.description: Activates a policy rule.
Deactivates a policy rule.

Creates a new session for a user with a valid session token. Use this API if, for example, you want to set the session cookie yourself instead of allowing Okta to set it, or want to hold the session ID in order to delete a session via the API instead of visiting the logout URL.

get.description: Get details about a session.
Enumerates custom SMS templates in your organization. A subset of templates can be returned that match a template type.

post.description: Adds a new custom SMS template to your organization.

delete.description: Removes an SMS template.

get.description: Fetches a specific template by `id`

post.description: Updates only some of the SMS template properties:

get.description: Gets current ThreatInsight configuration

post.description: Updates ThreatInsight configuration

get.description: Success

post.description: Success

delete.description: Success

get.description: Success

post.description: Success
Success

get.description: Lists users in your organization with pagination in most cases.  A subset of users can be returned that match a supported filter expression or search criteria.

parameters.description: Finds a user that matches firstName, lastName, and email properties
parameters.name: q

parameters.description: Specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of users
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: Specifies the number of results returned
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Filters users with a supported expression for a subset of properties
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: Searches for users with a supported filtering  expression for most properties
parameters.name: search

post.description: Creates a new user in your Okta organization with or without credentials.

parameters.description: Executes activation lifecycle operation when creating the user
parameters.name: activate

parameters.description: Indicates whether to create a user with a specified authentication provider
parameters.name: provider

parameters.description: With activate=true, set nextLogin to "changePassword" to have the password be EXPIRED, so user must change it the next time they log in.
parameters.name: nextLogin

delete.description: Deletes a user permanently.  This operation can only be performed on users that have a `DEPROVISIONED` status.  **This action cannot be recovered!**

get.description: Fetches a user from your Okta organization.

post.description: Fetch a user by `id`, `login`, or `login shortname` if the short name is unambiguous.

put.description: Update a user's profile and/or credentials using strict-update semantics.

get.description: Fetches appLinks for all direct or indirect (via group membership) assigned applications.
Lists all client resources for which the specified user has grants or tokens.

delete.description: Revokes all grants for the specified user and client

get.description: Lists all grants for a specified user and client

delete.description: Revokes all refresh tokens issued for the specified User and Client.

get.description: Lists all refresh tokens issued for the specified User and Client.

delete.description: Revokes the specified refresh token.

get.description: Gets a refresh token issued for the specified User and Client.

post.description: Changes a user's password by validating the user's current password. This operation can only be performed on users in `STAGED`, `ACTIVE`, `PASSWORD_EXPIRED`, or `RECOVERY` status that have a valid password credential

Changes a user's recovery question & answer credential by validating the user's current password.  This operation can only be performed on users in **STAGED**, **ACTIVE** or **RECOVERY** `status` that have a valid password credential

x-okta-multi-operation.description: Generates a one-time token (OTT) that can be used to reset a user's password
Sets a new password for a user by validating the user's answer to their current recovery question

get.description: Enumerates all the enrolled factors for the specified user

post.description: Enrolls a user with a supported factor.

parameters.description: id of SMS template (only for SMS factor)
parameters.name: templateId

get.description: Enumerates all the supported factors that can be enrolled for the specified user
Enumerates all available security questions for a user's `question` factor

delete.description: Unenrolls an existing factor for the specified user, allowing the user to enroll a new factor.

get.description: Fetches a factor for the specified user

post.description: The `sms` and `token:software:totp` factor types require activation to complete the enrollment process.

get.description: Polls factors verification transaction for status.

post.description: Verifies an OTP for a `token` or `token:hardware` factor

delete.description: Revokes all grants for a specified user

get.description: Lists all grants for the specified user

delete.description: Revokes one grant for a specified user

get.description: Gets a grant for the specified user
Fetches the groups of which the user is a member.
Lists the IdPs associated with the user.
get.summary: Listing IdPs associated with a user

post.description: Activates a user.  This operation can only be performed on users with a `STAGED` status.  Activation of a user is an asynchronous operation. The user will have the `transitioningToStatus` property with a value of `ACTIVE` during activation to indicate that the user hasn't completed the asynchronous operation.  The user will have a status of `ACTIVE` when the activation process is complete.

parameters.description: Sends an activation email to the user if true
parameters.name: sendEmail

post.description: Deactivates a user.  This operation can only be performed on users that do not have a `DEPROVISIONED` status.  Deactivation of a user is an asynchronous operation.  The user will have the `transitioningToStatus` property with a value of `DEPROVISIONED` during deactivation to indicate that the user hasn't completed the asynchronous operation.  The user will have a status of `DEPROVISIONED` when the deactivation process is complete.
This operation transitions the user to the status of `PASSWORD_EXPIRED` so that the user is required to change their password at their next login.
This operation transitions the user to the status of `PASSWORD_EXPIRED` and the user's password is reset to a temporary password that is returned.

Reactivates a user.  This operation can only be performed on users with a `PROVISIONED` status.  This operation restarts the activation workflow if for some reason the user activation was not completed when using the activationToken from [Activate User](#activate-user).

parameters.description: Sends an activation email to the user if true
parameters.name: sendEmail

post.description: This operation resets all factors for the specified user. All MFA factor enrollments returned to the unenrolled state. The user's status remains ACTIVE. This link is present only if the user is currently enrolled in one or more MFA factors.
Generates a one-time token (OTT) that can be used to reset a user's password.  The OTT link can be automatically emailed to the user or returned to the API caller and distributed using a custom flow.
Suspends a user.  This operation can only be performed on users with an `ACTIVE` status.  The user will have a status of `SUSPENDED` when the process is complete.
Unlocks a user with a `LOCKED_OUT` status and returns them to `ACTIVE` status.  Users will be able to login with their current password.
Unsuspends a user and returns them to the `ACTIVE` state.  This operation can only be performed on users that have a `SUSPENDED` status.

delete.description: Delete linked objects for a user, relationshipName can be ONLY a primary relationship name

get.description: Get linked objects for a user, relationshipName can be a primary or associated relationship name
Lists all roles assigned to a user.

post.description: Assigns a role to a user.

delete.description: Unassigns a role from a user.

get.description: Lists all App targets for an `APP_ADMIN` Role assigned to a User. This methods return list may include full Applications or Instances. The response for an instance will have an `ID` value, while Application will not have an ID.

delete.description: Success
Remove App Instance Target to App Administrator Role given to a User
delete.summary: Remove App Instance Target to App Administrator Role given to a User

put.description: Add App Instance Target to App Administrator Role given to a User
put.summary: Add App Instance Target to App Administrator Role given to a User

get.description: Success

delete.description: Success
Removes all active identity provider sessions. This forces the user to authenticate on the next operation. Optionally revokes OpenID Connect and OAuth refresh and access tokens issued to the user.

parameters.description: Revoke issued OpenID Connect and OAuth refresh and access tokens
parameters.name: oauthTokens

get.description: Enumerates network zones added to your organization with pagination. A subset of zones can be returned that match a supported filter expression or query.

parameters.description: Specifies the pagination cursor for the next page of network zones
parameters.name: after

parameters.description: Specifies the number of results for a page
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Filters zones by usage or id expression
parameters.name: filter

post.description: Adds a new network zone to your Okta organization.

delete.description: Removes network zone.

get.description: Fetches a network zone from your Okta organization by `id`.

put.description: Updates a network zone in your organization.

post.description: Activate Network Zone
Deactivates a network zone.

x-okta-operations.description: Adds a user to a group with 'OKTA_GROUP' type
